claim: Among hospitalized patients aged 50 years and older, more than half were receiving therapeutic anticoagulation at the time their anti-cardiolipin IgG was measured.
extra_info: in-patient refers to Admission = '+'; age 50 and above refers to SUBTRACT(year(current_timestamp), year(Birthday)) >= '50'; average anti-cardiolipin antibody (IgG) concentration refers to AVG(aCL IgG)
reasoning: The claim references 'therapeutic anticoagulation,' which is a treatment/medication concept. The database schema contains no columns or tables recording whether patients were receiving anticoagulation therapy. While the database has coagulation-related lab values (PT, APTT, FG) and examination data (KCT, RVVT, LAC), none of these indicate whether a patient was on anticoagulant treatment. This is an out-of-schema concept that cannot be verified from the available data.

content.text: I'll analyze this claim step by step. Let me first explore the database schema.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE Examination
(
    ID                 INTEGER          null,
    `Examination Date` DATE         null,
    `aCL IgG`          REAL        null,
    `aCL IgM`          REAL        null,
    ANA                INTEGER          null,
    `ANA Pattern`      TEXT null,
    `aCL IgA`          INTEGER          null,
    Diagnosis          TEXT null,
    KCT                TEXT null,
    RVVT              TEXT null,
    LAC                TEXT null,
    Symptoms           TEXT null,
    Thrombosis         INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE Patient
(
    ID           INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    SEX          TEXT  null,
    Birthday     DATE          null,
    Description  DATE          null,
    `First Date` DATE          null,
    Admission    TEXT  null,
    Diagnosis    TEXT  null
);
CREATE TABLE Laboratory
(
    ID        INTEGER  default 0            not null,
    Date      DATE default '0000-00-00' not null,
    GOT       INTEGER                       null,
    GPT       INTEGER                        null,
    LDH       INTEGER                        null,
    ALP       INTEGER                        null,
    TP        REAL             null,
    ALB       REAL             null,
    UA        REAL             null,
    UN        INTEGER                       null,
    CRE       REAL             null,
    `T-BIL`   REAL             null,
    `T-CHO`   INTEGER                       null,
    TG        INTEGER                       null,
    CPK       INTEGER                       null,
    GLU       INTEGER                       null,
    WBC       REAL             null,
    RBC       REAL             null,
    HGB       REAL             null,
    HCT       REAL             null,
    PLT       INTEGER                       null,
    PT        REAL             null,
    APTT      INTEGER                       null,
    FG        REAL             null,
    PIC       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT2      INTEGER                       null,
    `U-PRO`   TEXT              null,
    IGG       INTEGER                       null,
    IGA       INTEGER                       null,
    IGM       INTEGER                       null,
    CRP       TEXT              null,
    RA        TEXT              null,
    RF        TEXT              null,
    C3        INTEGER                       null,
    C4        INTEGER                       null,
    RNP       TEXT              null,
    SM        TEXT              null,
    SC170     TEXT              null,
    SSA       TEXT              null,
    SSB       TEXT              null,
    CENTROMEA TEXT              null,
    DNA       TEXT              null,
    `DNA-II`  INTEGER                       null,
    primary key (ID, Date),
        foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
Now I can see the schema. The claim mentions "therapeutic anticoagulation" - let me check if there's any column related to anticoagulation treatment in the database.

Looking at the schema:
- **Patient** table: ID, SEX, Birthday, Description, First Date, Admission, Diagnosis
- **Examination** table: ID, Examination Date, aCL IgG, aCL IgM, ANA, ANA Pattern, aCL IgA, Diagnosis, KCT, RVVT, LAC, Symptoms, Thrombosis
- **Laboratory** table: Various lab values including coagulation tests (PT, APTT, FG) but no treatment/medication data

The claim refers to "receiving therapeutic anticoagulation" — this is a treatment/medication concept. There is no column in any table that records whether a patient was receiving anticoagulation therapy. The database contains lab test results and examination findings, but not treatment information.

This is an **out-of-schema** claim — the concept of "therapeutic anticoagulation" (a medication/treatment) is not captured anywhere in the database schema.
